msContents.summary: The Kucalavarkaḷuṭaiya Katai, a prose narrative (compiled from different sources), on Kucalavaṉ, the son of Rāma and Sītā, by Rōmāpuri Cañciviṉāta-rāca-riṣi-kuru-cuvāmi (see U1, f224v6). Margherita Trento (personal communication) pointed out that Cañciviṉātar is the Tamil name of the Jesuit Jean Venance Bouchet (1655-1732) (see Clooney 2005, p. 74). On the same or a similar work, the Kucalavaṉ Katai, see Sweetman (2021, p. 89).

collation.desc: the front cover. Shelfmark on verso.
3 folios = front guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso. Shelfmark on f[1]r.

224 folios = Kucalavarkaḷuṭaiya Katai: Mūlam. Library foliation 1-224 on top right [taken as reference foliation for the present description]. Tamil foliation 1-72, 74-117, 119-190, 191-210, 212-217, 219-229 on top middle. Quires numbered in Tamil numerals.
7 folios = back guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso.

decoNote.desc: Initials at the beginning of chapters. More elaborate at the beginning of an attiyāyam/adhyāya; less elaborate for sub-parts (caṟkkam/sarga) of an attiyāyam. In pākam/bhāga II, for adhyāya 13 only.

additions.desc: Title (Latin transcription) in black ink: Kouchalavâkaloudaiya Katai.
BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 339 (front cover, verso).

See e.g.: lf4r, lf6r, lf7v, lf10v, lf15v (6th adhyāya), ..., f32r (10th), f33v (1st, of 2nd bhāga), f41v (3rd), ... f52v (6th), ... f76r (12th), f81v (13th).

binding.p: Paper cover (white). Title on the spine.

acquisition.p: It appears to be the histoire de Cochalaven en malabar en papier sent by the Jesuits of the Mission du Carnate in 1733 for the library of the king of France and mentioned in an ancien list (BnF NAF 5442, f9v).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 49.
Clooney, Francis X. (2005). Fr. Bouchet’s India: An 18th Century Jesuit's Encounter with Hinduism. Chennai: Satya Nilaiyam Publications.

Sweetman, Will and R. Ilakkuvan (2012). The Bibliotheca Malabarica: Bartholomäus Ziegenbalg’s Tamil Library: An Annotated edition and translation. Pondicherry: EFEO and IFP. (Indologie no. 119) ― See p. 89.

encodingDesc.p: Transliteration conventions ― Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). ― Abbreviations ― c = column, f = folio, lf = library foliation = lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.
